info.name: M/S Sumon Enterprise - Complete API
info.description:
Complete Postman collection for M/S Sumon Enterprise Backend API.

BASE URL: http://localhost:5002

## SETUP INSTRUCTIONS
1. Import this collection into Postman
2. Set the `baseUrl` variable to your server URL (default: http://localhost:5002)
3. Run **Auth > Register Admin** first to create an admin account
4. Run **Auth > Login** â€” the token will auto-save to `authToken` variable
5. All protected routes use `{{authToken}}` automatically

## COLLECTION VARIABLES
- `baseUrl` â€” your server base URL
- `authToken` â€” auto-set after login
- `projectId` â€” auto-set after creating a project
- `inquiryId` â€” auto-set after creating an inquiry
- `projectSlug` â€” auto-set after creating a project

variable.description: Base URL of your backend server
JWT token â€” auto-filled after login
Project ID â€” auto-filled after creating a project
Project slug â€” auto-filled after creating a project
Inquiry ID â€” auto-filled after creating an inquiry

request.description: Check if the server is up and running. No authentication required.

item.name: ðŸ” Auth
item.description: Authentication endpoints. Register creates an admin account. Login returns a JWT token that is auto-saved for use in all protected routes.

request.description:
Register a new admin account. âš ï¸ Should be disabled or protected in production.

Auto-saves the JWT token to `authToken` variable on success.

response.name: 400 Bad Request - Admin Exists

request.description: Login with admin credentials. The JWT token is automatically saved to the `authToken` collection variable and used in all subsequent protected requests.
Get the currently authenticated admin's profile. Requires a valid Bearer token.
Logout the current admin. Since JWT is stateless, this returns a success message. Discard the token on the client side.
Negative test: attempt login with wrong password. Expected: 401 Invalid credentials.
Negative test: login without password. Expected: 400 Please provide email and password.
Negative test: access a protected route without a token. Expected: 401 Not authorized, no token.
Negative test: access a protected route with an invalid/malformed token. Expected: 401 Not authorized, token failed.

item.name: ðŸ—ï¸ Projects (Public)
item.description: Public project endpoints â€” no authentication required.

request.description: Get all projects. Supports filtering, sorting, and pagination.

item.name: Get All Projects - Filter by Status (Ongoing)

query.description: Filter by status: Ongoing or Finished

request.description: Filter projects by status=Ongoing

item.name: Get All Projects - Filter by Status (Finished)
Get All Projects - Filter by Company

request.description: Filter projects by company name (partial, case-insensitive)

item.name: Get All Projects - Full Text Search

query.description: MongoDB $text search across projectName, description, company

request.description: Full-text search using MongoDB $text index across projectName, description, and company fields.
Get page 1 with 5 results per page.

item.name: Get All Projects - Sort by startDate ASC

request.description: Combined: filter ongoing projects, page 1, 5 per page, sorted by newest start date.
Get up to 4 featured projects (featured: true), sorted by newest start date.
Get a single project by its URL slug. The slug is auto-generated from projectName + company.
Get a project by a hardcoded example slug.
Get a single project by its MongoDB ObjectId.

item.name: [NEGATIVE] Get Project by ID - Invalid ID

request.description: Negative test: CastError â€” should return 404 Resource not found.

item.name: [NEGATIVE] Get Project by ID - Non-existent ID

request.description: Negative test: valid ObjectId format but no matching document. Expected: 404 Project not found.

item.name: ðŸ—ï¸ Projects (Admin - Protected)
item.description: Protected project endpoints. Require Authorization: Bearer {{authToken}} header.

request.description:
Create a new project using JSON body (no file upload). The project ID and slug are auto-saved to collection variables.

âš ï¸ Note: When uploading images, use form-data instead.

response.name: 201 Created - Project Created

formdata.value: An eco-conscious residential complex with solar panels and rooftop gardens across five towers.

formdata.description: Select one or more image files (JPEG/PNG/WebP, max 5MB each, max 10 files)

request.description:
Create a project with image file uploads using multipart/form-data.

Attach image files to the `images` field. Accepts up to 10 images.

Note: Use `address.plot`, `address.road` etc. as flat keys in form-data (not nested objects).

item.name: Create Project - Finished with Finish Date

body.raw:
{
  "projectName": "Heritage Plaza",
  "company": "M/S Sumon Enterprise",
  "description": "A completed commercial plaza with 42 retail units and a food court on the ground floor.",
  "address": {
    "plot": "3",
    "road": "7",
    "block": "A",
    "area": "Mirpur",
    "city": "Dhaka"
  },
  "status": "Finished",
  "startDate": "2020-03-01",
  "finishDate": "2022-12-31",
  "specifications": {
    "floors": "6",
    "areaPerFloor": "5000 sq ft",
    "totalArea": "30000 sq ft",
    "constructionType": "Steel Frame Structure"
  },
  "featured": false
}

request.description: Create a finished project with a finishDate.

body.raw:
{
  "projectName": "Skyline Tower (Updated)",
  "description": "Updated: A luxurious residential tower with premium finishes, rooftop pool, and 24/7 security.",
  "status": "Finished",
  "finishDate": "2025-06-30",
  "featured": true,
  "specifications.floors": "15",
  "specifications.totalArea": "36000 sq ft"
}

request.description: Update an existing project. Only provided fields are updated (partial update supported).
Partial update: only update status and finishDate.

formdata.description: New images to add (appended to existing images)

request.description: Update project and add new images via form-data. New images are appended to existing images array.
Delete a project by ID. Also deletes associated images from Cloudinary or local storage.
Negative test: missing required fields and invalid values. Expected: 400 Validation failed with field-level errors.
Negative test: attempt to create a project without auth token. Expected: 401 Not authorized, no token.
Negative test: delete a project that doesn't exist. Expected: 404 Project not found.

item.name: ðŸ“© Inquiries (Public)
item.description: Public inquiry endpoint â€” no authentication required. Allows website visitors to submit contact form inquiries.

body.raw:
{
  "name": "Rahman Ahmed",
  "email": "rahman.ahmed@example.com",
  "phone": "01712345678",
  "subject": "Project Inquiry for Bashundhara",
  "message": "I am interested in purchasing a unit in your upcoming Bashundhara project. Please send me the floor plan and pricing details."
}

request.description:
Submit a contact form inquiry. No authentication required. Triggers email notifications to the admin and a confirmation email to the user.

Inquiry ID is auto-saved to `inquiryId` variable.

response.name: 201 Created - Inquiry Submitted

body.raw:
{
  "name": "Ali Khan",
  "email": "ali.khan@gmail.com",
  "phone": "01987654321",
  "subject": "General inquiry",
  "message": "I would like to know more about your services and ongoing projects."
}

request.description: Another valid inquiry submission.

Negative test: all fields fail validation:
- name too short (min 2)
- invalid email format
- empty phone
- subject too short (min 5)
- message too short (min 10)

Expected: 400 Validation failed with errors array.

response.name: 400 Validation Failed

request.description: Negative test: submit completely empty body. Expected: 400 Validation failed with all fields required.

body.raw:
{
  "name": "Test User",
  "email": "test@example.com",
  "phone": "abc-xyz",
  "subject": "Test Subject Here",
  "message": "This is a valid test message for the inquiry form."
}

request.description: Negative test: invalid phone number format. Expected: 400 Please provide a valid phone number.

item.name: ðŸ“© Inquiries (Admin - Protected)
item.description: Admin-only inquiry management endpoints. All require Bearer token authentication.

request.description: Get all inquiries (admin only). Supports filtering by status and pagination.

item.name: Get All Inquiries - Filter by Status (unread)
Get All Inquiries - Filter by Status (read)
Get All Inquiries - Filter by Status (replied)

request.description: Get inquiry statistics: total count, unread count, read count, and replied count.
Get a single inquiry by ID (admin only).

item.name: Update Inquiry Status - Mark as Read

request.description: Mark an inquiry as read. Also sets the `readAt` timestamp.

item.name: Update Inquiry Status - Mark as Replied

request.description: Mark an inquiry as replied.

item.name: Update Inquiry Status - Mark as Unread

request.description: Re-mark an inquiry as unread.
Permanently delete an inquiry by ID.
Negative test: access admin inquiries list without token. Expected: 401 Not authorized, no token.
Negative test: invalid status value (not in enum: unread, read, replied). Expected: 400 Validation failed.
Negative test: get an inquiry with a valid but non-existent ID. Expected: 404 Inquiry not found.

item.name: ðŸš« Error & Edge Cases
item.description: Tests for global error handling, 404 routes, and rate limiting.

request.description: Test the global 404 handler. Expected: { success: false, error: { message: 'Route not found', statusCode: 404 } }
Tests Mongoose CastError handling. Passing a non-ObjectId string triggers the error handler, which returns 404 Resource not found.

item.name: Duplicate Key Error - Register Same Email

request.description: Tests duplicate key error. Registering with the same email twice triggers a 400 error with the authController check OR a 409 from the global error handler (MongoDB duplicate key).

response.name: 400 Already Exists

request.description: Send DELETE to a POST-only route. Express returns 404 since no DELETE handler is registered for /api/auth/login.
